en_title: Five law students complimented for outstanding law reform essays (with photo)
zh_title: 五名法律系學生憑優越作品在法律改革徵文比賽獲獎（附圖）

en: The following is issued on behalf of the Law Reform Commission:
Five law students were complimented for their well-argued and thoroughly researched law reform essays at the Law Reform Essay Competition Certificate Award Ceremony today (June 15).

The essay competition was organised by the Law Reform Commission (LRC) for the second time so as to promote the importance of law reform among law students. It also provides the students with an opportunity to propose how a given area of Hong Kong law may be reformed.

The topic for this year's competition was "Should Hong Kong legislate on cyber-bullying? If so, how?". The five winners, coming from the law faculties of the University of Hong Kong and the Chinese University of Hong Kong, were awarded with a one-month attachment at leading law firms, barristers' chambers or the Department of Justice.

Officiating at the ceremony, the Secretary for Justice, Mr Rimsky Yuen, SC, who is the Chairman of the LRC, said that the topic reflects the ever-changing and increasingly technological environment in which we live, where bullying can take place not only at home, school or the workplace, but also in the virtual world of cyberspace.
He pointed out that law reform plays an important role in any community which aspires to maintain the rule of law.

"By offering law students an opportunity, not only to study a specific area of Hong Kong law, but also to consider and propose how it may be reformed, we hope that the competition will help to foster amongst Hong Kong law students an awareness and interest in law reform, as well as to enhance their understanding of its importance, complexity and implications," he said.
Mr Yuen thanked the sponsoring law firms and barristers' chambers for their valuable support in offering an internship as a prize to the finalists.
The five winning essays are available on the LRC's website:
Ends/Monday, Jun 15, 2015
zh: 下稿代法律改革委員會發出：
五名法律系學生以其說理明晰、研究透徹的法律改革論文，在今日（六月十五日）舉行的法律改革徵文比賽獎狀頒發典禮中獲得嘉許。
該項徵文比賽由法律改革委員會（法改會）第二次舉辦，目的是讓法律系學生認識法律改革的重要性，讓他們有機會就香港法律的特定範疇提出改革建議。
今年徵文比賽的題目是「香港應否就網上欺凌立法？如屬肯定，則應如何立法？」。五名得獎者分別來自香港大學和香港中文大學的法律學院，他們獲派往知名律師行、大律師事務所或律政司實習一個月。
律政司司長兼法改會主席袁國強資深大律師在主持頒獎禮時表示，比賽題目反映出資訊科技在我們生活的環境不斷轉變及進步，欺凌事件不單於家庭、學校或工作場所發生，也存在於網絡的虛擬世界。
他指出，在任何矢志維護法治的社會，法律改革發揮重要作用。
他說：「法律系學生不但有機會探討香港法律的特定範疇，也可以考慮如何改革有關問題和提出改革建議。我們希望這比賽有助提高學生對法律改革的認識和興趣，並加深他們了解有關工作的重要性、複雜性和影響。」
袁國強感謝贊助這次比賽的律師行和大律師事務所鼎力支持，向得獎者提供實習職位作為獎品。
五名得獎者的優勝作品已上載法改會網站，網址為：
